snippet.title: Appeals Court overrules lower court, upholds breast cancer gene test
snippet.description: ...A bit over two years ago, a large collection of interested parties joined together with the ACLU to challenge a practice that had become business as usual: the patenting of human genes. The group filed a suit that targeted a specific set of patents: those used by Myriad Genetics to control the market for tests of the BRCA breast cancer genes. In a surprise result, the judge overseeing the case is...

snippet.title: Ambry hits back at Myriad’s “bad faith enforcement” of breast cancer gene patents
snippet.description: ...For many years, all testing of the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes in the US was under control of one company: Myriad Genetics of Utah. But many expected that monopoly to be over when the Supreme Court ruled 9-0 that Myriad can't claim patent rights to those genes. In fact, the court ruled, such "isolated" DNA sequences can't get patents at allalthough a lab-made form of the gene called...
